verses.text: Not to us, O LORD, not to us but to your name be the glory, because of your love and faithfulness.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 115 This psalm is a liturgy for public worship, declaring Israel’s faith in the Lord over against the worthless idols of the nations.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:1
rsbNotes.text: 115:1 your steadfast love. God’s covenantal affection for His people.

verses.text: Why do the nations say, "Where is their God?"

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:2
rsbNotes.text:
115:2 the nations. The nations that surrounded Israel at different times: Canaan, Babylonia, Assyria, Persia, and Egypt.

Where is their God. As the nations observed Israel struggling, they would say that Israel’s God was unable or unwilling to act.

verses.text: Our God is in heaven; he does whatever pleases him.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:3
rsbNotes.text: 115:3 all that he pleases. A notable expression of God’s sovereignty.

verses.text: But their idols are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.
They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but they cannot see;
they have ears, but cannot hear, noses, but they cannot smell;
they have hands, but cannot feel, feet, but they cannot walk; nor can they utter a sound with their throats.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:4
rsbNotes.text: 115:4 Their idols. The psalmist draws a sharp contrast between the living God of Israel and the man-made deities of the Near East. See Is. 44:6–23; Rom. 1:21–23; “Syncretism and Idolatry” at Hos. 2:13.

verses.text: Those who make them will be like them, and so will all who trust in them.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:8
rsbNotes.text: 115:8 like them. When people construct their own gods, they make them in their own image. As they worship these gods, they are more and more conformed to their likeness. See 2 Kin. 17:15.

verses.text: O house of Israel, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:9
rsbNotes.text: 115:9 O Israel. A reference to all the people of God.

verses.text: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:10
rsbNotes.text: 115:10 house of Aaron. The speaker addresses the priests of Israel.

verses.text: You who fear him, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:11
rsbNotes.text: 115:11 You who fear the Lord. Finally, the psalmist singles out those who tremble before the Lord. These are the faithful within Israel or, as later usage suggests, also proselytes.

verses.text: The LORD remembers us and will bless us: He will bless the house of Israel, he will bless the house of Aaron,
he will bless those who fear the LORD - small and great alike.
May the LORD make you increase, both you and your children.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:12
rsbNotes.text: 115:12 remembered. See Ps. 44:1.

verses.text: May you be blessed by the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:15
rsbNotes.text: 115:15 who made heaven and earth. As the Creator of all, God is able to provide for His people the material blessings they need.

verses.text: The highest heavens belong to the LORD, but the earth he has given to man.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:16
rsbNotes.text: 115:16 the earth he has given to the children of man. God created the earth and it belongs to Him. Along with the gift of the earth comes the responsibility to work and serve God faithfully.

verses.text: It is not the dead who praise the LORD, those who go down to silence;
it is we who extol the LORD, both now and forevermore. Praise the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 115:17
rsbNotes.text: 115:17 The dead. See note Ps. 88:5.
